         <li id="cite_note-H-LH-311"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-H-LH_311-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFHelen-Louise_Hunter1999" class="citation book cs1">Helen-Louise Hunter (1999). <i>Kim Il-song's North Korea</i>. Foreword by Stephen J. Solarz. Westport, Connecticut, London: Praeger. pp.&nbsp;3–11, 31–33. <a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-275-96296-8" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-275-96296-8"><bdi>978-0-275-96296-8</bdi></a>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Kim+Il-song%27s+North+Korea&amp;rft.place=Westport%2C+Connecticut%2C+London&amp;rft.pages=3-11%2C+31-33&amp;rft.pub=Praeger&amp;rft.date=1999&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-275-96296-8&amp;rft.au=Helen-Louise+Hunter&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ANorth+Korea" class="Z3988"></span></span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-BRHLH-312"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-BRHLH_312-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFJerry_Winzig" class="citation web cs1">Jerry Winzig. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.winzigconsultingservices.com/files/samples/kq/Helen_Hunter.html">"A Look at North Korean Society"</a> <span class="cs1-format">(book review of 'Kim Il-song's North Korea' by Helen-Louise Hunter)</span>. winzigconsultingservices.com<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">8 June</span> 2011</span>. <q>In North Korea, one's songbun, or socio-economic and class background, is extremely important and is primarily determined at birth. People with the best songbun are descendants of the anti-Japanese guerrillas who fought with Kim Il-song, followed by people whose parents or grandparents were factory workers, laborers, or poor, small farmers in 1950. "Ranked below them in descending order are forty-seven distinct groups in what must be the most class-differentiated society in the world today." Anyone with a father, uncle, or grandfather who owned land or was a doctor, Christian minister, merchant, or lawyer has low songbun.</q></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=A+Look+at+North+Korean+Society&amp;rft.pub=winzigconsultingservices.com&amp;rft.au=Jerry+Winzig&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.winzigconsultingservices.com%2Ffiles%2Fsamples%2Fkq%2FHelen_Hunter.html&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ANorth+Korea" class="Z3988"></span></span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-313"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-313">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFTim_Sullivan2012" class="citation news cs1">Tim Sullivan (29 December 2012). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20130128184102/http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2012/12/29/north-korea-songbun-caste-system_n_2380799.html">"North Korea's Songbun Caste System Faces Power Of Wealth"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/The_Huffington_Post" class="mw-redirect" title="The Huffington Post">The Huffington Post</a></i>. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">28 February</span> 2013</span>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=The+Huffington+Post&amp;rft.atitle=North+Korea%27s+Songbun+Caste+System+Faces+Power+Of+Wealth&amp;rft.date=2012-12-29&amp;rft.au=Tim+Sullivan&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.huffingtonpost.com%2F2012%2F12%2F29%2Fnorth-korea-songbun-caste-system_n_2380799.html&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ANorth+Korea" class="Z3988"></span></span> </li>

         <li id="cite_note-FOOTNOTECountry_Profile20079-321"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-FOOTNOTECountry_Profile20079_321-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="#CITEREFCountry_Profile2007">Country Profile 2007</a>, p.&nbsp;9.</span> </li>

           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://whc.unesco.org/en/statesparties/KP/">"Democratic People's Republic of Korea"</a>. <a href="/wiki/UNESCO" title="UNESCO">UNESCO</a>. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20140701105958/https://whc.unesco.org/en/statesparties/kp">Archived</a> from the original on 1 July 2014<span class="reference-accessdate">.          <li id="cite_note-418"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-418">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFPark2020" class="citation news cs1">Park, Han-na (24 June 2020). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.koreaherald.com/view.php?ud=20200624000694">"North Korea lauds Harry Potter"</a>.            <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://100.naver.com/100.nhn?docid=186015"><bdi lang="ko">Korean Cuisine (한국요리 韓國料理)</bdi></a> (in Korean). <a href="/wiki/Naver" title="Naver">Naver</a> / <a href="/wiki/Doosan_Encyclopedia" title="Doosan Encyclopedia">Doosan Encyclopedia</a><span class="reference-accessdate">.          <li id="cite_note-438"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-438">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.korea.net/AboutKorea/Korean-Life/Food">"Food"</a>.          <li id="cite_note-Okryu-439"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-Okryu_439-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Okryu_439-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">

      <h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Sources">Sources</span></h2> 
      <style data-mw-deduplicate="TemplateStyles:r1004355016">.mw-parser-output .refbegin{font-size:90%;margin-bottom:0.5em}.mw-parser-output .refbegin-hanging-indents>ul{margin-left:0}.mw-parser-output .refbegin-hanging-indents>ul>li{margin-left:0;padding-left:3.2em;text-indent:-3.2em}.mw-parser-output .refbegin-hanging-indents ul,.mw-parser-output .refbegin-hanging-indents ul li{list-style:none}@media(max-width:720px){.mw-parser-output .refbegin-hanging-indents>ul>li{padding-left:1.6em;text-indent:-1.6em}}.mw-parser-output .refbegin-100{font-size:100%}.mw-parser-output .refbegin-columns{margin-top:0.3em}.mw-parser-output .refbegin-columns dl,.mw-parser-output .refbegin-columns ol,.mw-parser-output .refbegin-columns ul{margin-top:0}.mw-parser-output .refbegin-columns li,.mw-parser-output .refbegin-columns dd{page-break-inside:avoid;break-inside:avoid-column}</style>
      <div class="refbegin refbegin-columns references-column-width" style="column-width: 30em"> 
       <ul>
        <li>
         <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFCountry_Profile2007" class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.loc.gov/rr/frd/cs/profiles/North_Korea-new.pdf">"Country Profile: North Korea"</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>.         <li>Armstrong, Charles K. "North Korea in 2016." <i>Asian Survey</i> 57.1 (2017): 119–27. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://as.ucpress.edu/content/57/1/119">abstract</a></li> 
        <li>
         <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFFrench2007" class="citation book cs1">French, Paul (2007). <i>North Korea: The Paranoid Peninsula: A Modern History</i> (Second&nbsp;ed.).         <li>Hayes, Peter, and Roger Cavazos. "North Korea in 2015." <i>Asian Survey</i> 56.1 (2016): 68–77. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://as.ucpress.edu/content/56/1/68.abstract">abstract</a></li> 
        <li>Hayes, Peter, and Roger Cavazos. "North Korea in 2014." <i>Asian Survey</i> 55.1 (2015): 119–31. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://as.ucpress.edu/content/55/1/119.abstract">abstract</a>; also <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://nautilus.org/napsnet/napsnet-special-reports/north-korea-in-2014-a-fresh-leap-forward-into-thin-air/">full text online</a></li> 
        <li>
         <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFJackson2016" class="citation book cs1">Jackson, Van (2016). <i>Rival Reputations: Coercion and Credibility in US–North Korea Relations</i>. Cambridge: Cambridge University Press. <a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-1-107-13331-0" title="Special:BookSources/978-1-107-13331-0"><bdi>978-1-107-13331-0</bdi></a>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Rival+Reputations%3A+Coercion+and+Credibility+in+US%E2%80%93North+Korea+Relations&amp;rft.place=Cambridge&amp;rft.pub=Cambridge+University+Press&amp;rft.date=2016&amp;rft.isbn=978-1-107-13331-0&amp;rft.aulast=Jackson&amp;rft.aufirst=Van&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ANorth+Korea" class="Z3988"></span>, covers 1960s to 2010.</li> 
        <li>Jackson, Van. "Deterring a Nuclear-Armed Adversary in a Contested Regional Order: The 'Trilemma' of US–North Korea Relations." <i>Asia Policy</i> 23.1 (2017): 97–103. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://muse.jhu.edu/article/647791/summary">online</a></li> 
        <li>Lee, Hong Yung. "North Korea in 2013: Economy, Executions, and Nuclear Brinksmanship." <i>Asian Survey</i> 54.1 (2014): 89–100. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://home.sogang.ac.kr/sites/jaechun/courses/Lists/b7/Attachments/21/as.2014.54.1.89.pdf">online</a></li> 
        <li>
         <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFMartin2004" class="citation book cs1">Martin, Bradley K.         <li>
         <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFMyers2011" class="citation book cs1"><a href="/wiki/Brian_Reynolds_Myers" title="Brian Reynolds Myers">Myers, Brian Reynolds</a> (2011). <a href="/wiki/The_Cleanest_Race" title="The Cleanest Race"><i>The Cleanest Race: How North Koreans See Themselves and Why It Matters</i></a>.       <h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Government_websites">Government websites</span></h3> 
      <ul>
       <li><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://kcna.kp/kcna.user.home.retrieveHomeInfoList.kcmsf?lang=eng">KCNA</a> – website of the <a href="/wiki/Korean_Central_News_Agency" title="Korean Central News Agency">Korean Central News Agency</a></li> 
       <li><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://naenara.com.kp/main/index/en/first">Naenara</a> – the official North Korean governmental portal <a href="/wiki/Naenara" title="Naenara">Naenara</a></li> 
       <li><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.mfa.gov.kp/en/">DPRK Foreign Ministry</a> – official north Korean foreign ministry website</li> 
       <li><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20171130171957/http://www.pyongyangtimes.com.kp/">The Pyongyang Times</a> – official foreign language newspaper of the DPRK</li>
      </ul> 
      <h3><span class="mw-headline" id="General_websites">General websites</span></h3> 
      <ul>
       <li><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://curlie.org/Regional/Asia/North_Korea">North Korea</a> at <a href="/wiki/Curlie" class="mw-redirect" title="Curlie">Curlie</a></li>

       <li><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://38north.org/">38North</a></li> 
       <li><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-pacific-15256929">North Korea profile</a> at <a href="/wiki/BBC_News" title="BBC News">BBC News</a></li> 
       <li><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20090612212909/http://ucblibraries.colorado.edu/govpubs/for/nkorea.htm">North Korea</a> – link collection (<a href="/wiki/University_of_Colorado_at_Boulder" class="mw-redirect" title="University of Colorado at Boulder">University of Colorado at Boulder</a> Libraries GovPubs)</li> 
       <li><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.nknews.org/">NKnews</a> – a news agency covering North Korean topics.</li> 
       <li><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.friend.com.kp/index.php?module=home&amp;current_language=en">Friend.com.kp</a> – website of the <a href="/wiki/Committee_for_Cultural_Relations_with_Foreign_Countries" title="Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries">Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries</a></li> 
       <li><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.koredufund.org.kp/">Korea Education Fund</a></li> 
       <li><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20150702044729/http://www.rodong.rep.kp/en/"><i>Rodong Sinmun</i></a> – the newspaper of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea <i><a href="/wiki/Rodong_Sinmun" title="Rodong Sinmun">Rodong Sinmun</a></i></li> 
       <li><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.uriminzokkiri.com/">Uriminzokkiri</a></li> 
       <li><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.dprkportal.kp/">DPRK Portal</a></li>

            <a href="/wiki/Korean_Unification_Flag" title="Korean Unification Flag"><img alt="Unification flag of Korea.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8a/Unification_flag_of_Korea.svg/24px-Unification_flag_of_Korea.svg.png" decoding="async" width="24" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8a/Unification_flag_of_Korea.svg/36px-Unification_flag_of_Korea.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8a/Unification_flag_of_Korea.svg/48px-Unification_flag_of_Korea.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="900" data-file-height="600"></a> <a href="/wiki/Index_of_Korea-related_articles" title="Index of Korea-related articles">Index of Korea-related articles</a>
           </div></th>
         </tr>

                     <table class="nowraplinks navbox-subgroup" style="border-spacing:0">
                      <tbody>
                       <tr>
                        <th scope="row" class="navbox-group" style="width:1%">Short-lived</th>
                        <td class="navbox-list navbox-odd" style="text-align:left;border-left-width:2px;border-left-style:solid;width:100%;padding:0px">
                         <div style="padding:0em 0.25em"> 
                          <ul>
                           <li><a href="/wiki/Persian_Socialist_Soviet_Republic" title="Persian Socialist Soviet Republic">Gilan</a></li>

                          </ul> 
                         </div></td>
                       </tr>
                      </tbody>
                     </table>
                     <div> 
                     </div></td>
                   </tr>
                   <tr>
                    <th scope="row" class="navbox-group" style="width:1%">Europe</th>
